A couple of weeks ago, a poll conducted by the Harvard Institute of Politics found something startling: only 19% of Americans ages 18 to 29 identified themselves as “capitalists.” In the richest and most market-oriented country in the world, only 42% of that group said they “supported capitalism.” The numbers were higher among older people; still, only 26% considered themselves capitalists. A little over half supported the system as a whole.This represents more than just millennials not minding the label “socialist” or disaffected middle-aged Americans...]]>http://www.realclearpolitics.com/2016/05/12/capitalism039s_great_crisis_382447.htmlhttp://time.com/4327419/american-capitalisms-great-crisis/?xid=homepage 100382447 PM Update Rana Foroohar, Time]]> Capitalism's Great Crisis America's Shrinking Middle ClassThu, 12 May 2016 14:02:59 -0500 05/12/2016/00/00/00 Pew Research Center
The American middle class is losing ground in metropolitan areas across the country, affecting communities from Boston to Seattle and from Dallas to Milwaukee. From 2000 to 2014 the share of adults living in middle-income households fell in 203 of the 229 U.S. metropolitan areas examined in a new Pew Research Center analysis of government data. The decrease in the middle-class share was often substantial, measuring 6 percentage points or more in 53 metropolitan areas, compared with a 4-point drop nationally.]]>http://www.realclearpolitics.com/2016/05/12/america039s_shrinking_middle_class_382448.htmlhttp://www.pewsocialtrends.org/2016/05/11/americas-shrinking-middle-class-a-close-look-at-changes-within-metropolitan-areas/ 100382448 PM Update America's Shrinking Middle Class Trump Presidency Would Restore Power to the PeopleThu, 12 May 2016 14:04:17 -0500 05/12/2016/00/00/00 Charles Hurt, Wash Times
